title: [K-12] Direct Instruction and Constructivist Application Strategies for Integrated Instructional Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Understanding of Linguistics and Education, Digital Tool Proficiency
context.additional_context: Requires customized design considering individual learner competency differences. Cultivates practical application skills through project-based assessment.

learning_goals: Learners can explain criteria for selecting instructional methods tailored to educational contexts using the integrated instructional design paradigm model (4-quadrant framework)
Learners can develop blended lesson materials combining direct instruction and constructivist approaches and establish implementation plans
Learners can design project-based assessment tools considering learners' proficiency levels and domain complexity (Cynefin Framework)
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
